reviewText: Long ago I watched this and loved it. I was very young and I guess times changed and the movie now is nice, but a bit corny too. It is a lovely story, but in todays world it would need a lot of polish and better writting. Timothy Bottoms was not as good as you would want him to be. Marie Osmond was surprisingly wonderful. If only she would go back to acting. It makes you wonder what she'd be like today. She was very young making this movie and very good at it.

reviewText: My very favorite movie!  I remember seeing this on TV many years ago and being captivated by the story.  I hunted down the title on the internet and am so glad I found it.  This movie presents a sweet, tender, and innocent portrayal of real, true love. Far too many people think this no longer exists, but it does. I know from personal experience! This is an excellent movie for singles, marrieds, and families. I've watched it 4 times in the week I've had it! Beautiful!
summary: My Favorite Movie! Charming and Tender!
Title: Gift of Love VHS

reviewText: This is an adaptation of O'Henry's The Gift of the Magi but there's no mention of that in the product description. Also,While the camera loves Marie Osmond, her acting is stilted. June Lockhart performance is cringeworthy. Timothy Bottoms is the only "real" actor of the bunch  & because of him the production is somewhat elevated.The quality of the video was bad. Overall, it's a poor video quality "Hallmark"-ish movie...would watch it for free if I had nothing else to watch but it's not worth renting,
summary: Poor Quality & Misleading Description:It's really O'Henry's The Gift of the Magi
Title: Gift of Love VHS

reviewText: Chances are, if you are reading this review, you are already a fan of this movie, or a fan of Maire Osmond, either of which makes you a superbly fantastic person.  Congratulations on the wonderfulness that is you.  Now, onto the movie. . . While often passed off just as a Christmas movie (and, don't get me wrong it should be watched at least twice every Holiday season), I also just watch this movie when I am a little down or feeling really happy already.  It will leave you warm and tingly for days.  I truly don't think the story could be any sweeter, or acted any more lovingly.  Now, it is easy to assume that such a sweet love story would be cheesy.  It's not, not at all.  However, it is the definition of innocence, which can be mistaken as cheesy.  The acting, as stated before, is perfect for the story, the one song she sings is haunting and will stay with you, the filming technique (while dated and not high quality) actually adds a warmth and dimension to the film.  Get this movie, share it with someone you can snuggle up close to and fall asleep with.  Truly wonderful!
Title: Gift of Love VHS

reviewText: Yes, it's a bit old fashioned and yes, it's somewhat predictable. But then, in great measure, so is pure love. This story evolves around multiple disciplines and emotions; e.g., loyalty, promises, obedience, hope, perseverance, longing, honor, false guilt, anger, trust, desire, etc. It is well told by the actors and narrator, and serves as a fine example of how love surpasses the lesser things in life, despite how those lesser things are often viewed by some as the most meaningful. Like the old saying clearly states, "love conquers all."
Title: Gift of Love VHS

reviewText: I will admit that I heaved a sigh of disappointment when I saw Marie Osmond step out of the carriage.  However, she quickly won me over and I loved every minute of this film after that.  This story is wonderfully touching and in the end, their gifts to one another are funny but really felt.  You KNOW that they are gifts from the heart.  This movie really is about love at Christmastime and the actors in this version couldn't have been better chosen.  They all do a great job and I would recommend this film to anyone!  I plan to watch it time and again!
summary: Really, REALLY good... a definite MUST SEE!
Title: Gift of Love VHS

reviewText: This Osmond production is one of the best family movies out there.  It is a touching story with excellent acting by Marie Osmond and Timothy Bottoms and all the supporting cast as well. I particularly like the friendship between Beth and Mary the servant girl.  My teenage niece said there was only one "cheesy" part when the main characters reunite at the end.  I prefer to call it touching, lol! :-)  The costumes, the story line, EVERYTHING, is extremely well done.  It supports Christian and family values, and there is certainly nothing that is in any way offensive.  I would highly recommend this one.  The Christmas theme also adds a nice touch.  I also will mention that the video is closed captioned, although it does not say so on the case.  I am glad for that as the two oldest Osmond brothers, who have a hearing loss, can more easily watch their sister in this outstanding film!
summary: Wonderful, One of My Favourite Christmas Movies of All Time
Title: Gift of Love VHS

Title: Gift of Love VHS

reviewText: I watched this touching story of love and selfless giving many years ago, probably when it was first made in 1978, and have never had the opportunity to see it again.  When I found it was on DVD, I was thrilled to be able to buy it for my collection of Christmas movies.The story is based on a short story written by O. Henry, a writer of the late 19th century, called The Gift of the Magi.  This movie is a story set in the early 1900s, so the wardrobes and sets bring you back to a more romantic time.  It's about a young couple who fall in love against the wishes of family and out of line with proper associations between the classes.Marie Osmond is beautiful as the young Beth promised in marriage to a wealthy man she does not love.  She sings a beautiful song "The Gift of Love" upon which they drew the name of the movie.  Timothy Bottoms is Rudy, an immigrant from Switzerland (also destined to marry a girl he does not love).  In keeping with the original story, they both sacrifice the most valuable things they own to give a gift to the other.This is a love story made back in the day when a love story wasn't about sex, money, or a reality show.  You can watch this one with your whole family and feel good about the message your children will go away with.
summary: A love story for the whole family.
Title: Gift of Love VHS

reviewText: A sweet love story where two young people unexpectedly fall in love and the young lady calls off a prearranged marriage offering great wealth and a life of ease in favor of a life offering only true love. How does it end? Buy the movie. You won't be disappointed.By the way, The song The Precious Gift of Love will stick in your mind and you will find yourself singing and humming; but you won't mind. The words are lovely and the tune is simply beautiful.
summary: A MOVIE THAT YOU WILL NEVER FORGET ! .....
Title: Gift of Love VHS

reviewText: Great movie! I showed it to my students after reading O. Henry's "The Gift of the Magi". It made for a great lesson on comparison/contrast after reading the story. My students had no clue who Marie Osmond was and were impressed with her singing. One student said, "She sure can sing!" Yes, she certainly can. She is also a delightful actress. It's a great DVD to show right before Christmas vacation.
Title: Gift of Love VHS
